wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Donald John Dean   (19 April 1897 – 9 December 1985) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Lt Donald John Dean, 8th Battalion, The Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Donald John Dean || British Army || 1918 || First World War || Lens

Donald John Dean VC OBE of Sittingbourne was awarded the Victoria Cross for deeds carried out in France in 1918.  His ashes are interred in the family plot at St John the Baptist Church, Tunstall, Kent.

link_mentions.page: Index of World War II articles (D)

response: * Colonel Donald John Dean, , Member, Kent Territorial and Auxiliary Forces Association.
